div.pre: 1928 Carosino, 15 km. E of Taranto, Calabria, 1905 (208) Burial: 334-330 B.C. (Vlasto) Contents: c. 230 AR Taras: 75 st. (10 early; 24 Per. III; 41 Per. IV A-E, H) CNG Triton IV, lot 28 CNG 81 (2009) lot: 33 16 diob. (Per. III-IV) Heracleia: 2 st. (cf. Work 29, 32) Metapontum: 10+ st. (to Noe 507 plus Leucippus) Poseidonia: 1 st. Thurium: 12 st. (incl. issues signed K, HP, Molossus) Velia: 2 st. Caulonia: 5 st. Croton: 7 st. Terina: 1 st. Disposition: Taranto 76 (incl. nearly all the non-Tarentine above); Vlasto 50 (Cat. 297, 359, 379, 391-2, 395, 399, 400-1, 410, 422, 426, 467, 490, 496, 503, 505, 508-9, 511, 517, 519, 523, 539-40, 542, 544-6, 550-2, 554-5, 557-8, 1239, 1244-5, 1247-8, 1251, 1255-7, 1261-2, 1266, 1268, 1300); Lloyd 5 (SNG 161, 174, 178-9, 341); Jameson 1 (Cat. 138); New York 7-11 (4-5 Taras: SNG 864, 900, 902, 915, 969 ?; 3 Metapontum?: SNG 283, 297, 314; 3 Thurium: SNG 987, 1032-3). (Some of the New York pieces may be from the Ionian Shore 1908 hd., no. 1916 above) Evans, NC 1912, pp. 45, 51, note 61 Vlasto, NC 1926, pp. 218-22 Quagliati, AttiMemIIN 6 (1930), pp. 3-45, illus. Stazio, AIIN 1965-7, pp. 39-40 Kraay, ANSMN 16 (1970), pp. 23-30 The total c. 230 is that given by Noe; it seems not to be found in any of his printed sources. Noe also recorded Corinth, Leucas and Ambracia for this hd., but these mints seem to have been mistakenly transferred from the Ionian Shore hd. (no. 1916): see Kraay, ANSMN 16 A second coin of Terina believed by Evans (p. 45) to be from this hd. was later shown by Vlasto to be intrusive
